title: 其實意大利外長話華春瑩講假新聞係咪真

replies.msg:
一直以黎見到嘅都係華文傳媒講
去google搵一單英文news都冇
定還是意大利文嘅新聞有講

意大利媒體Linkiesta報道，意大利外交部長迪馬約（Luigi Di Maio）嚴正駁斥，指華春瑩在「散播假新聞」。

https://hk.appledaily.com/china/20200316/5LBJG42HE2RXHYIN3R3WFGRZR4/


意大利媒體Linkiesta報道，意大利外交部長迪馬約（Luigi Di Maio）嚴正駁斥，指華春瑩在「散播假新聞」。

replies.msg:
我剩係見到呢一媒體有講
無理由英文媒體冇
流架,意大利外長讚中國

另附上義大利報導原文聯結如下:

https://www.linkiesta.it/it/article/2020/03/15/coronavirus-cina-italia-fake-news/45851/


唔識意大利文

Google translate

Hua Chunying is the spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Minister, as well as general director of the Beijing Information Department, that is, she is among the leaders of Chinese propaganda. His role evidently also includes spreading fake news, like the one he tweeted from his official profile.

The Beijing spokeswoman showed pictures of some Italians who came out on the balconies on Saturday at noon to applaud the medical and hospital staff engaged in dealing with the epidemiological emergency, also from China, explaining that the Italians had come to the windows to sing "Thank you China" and to spread the Chinese anthem on the streets of Rome in gratitude for the Chinese help in defeating the virus. By clicking on the video, the applause of the Italians is heard and the Chinese anthem is marked in the background. His deputy, Lijian Zhao, did the same thing.

We have other emergencies, other problems and maybe there will also have been someone who screamed thanks China, but if we were a serious country, the Farnesina and the minister who unfortunately the guide would make themselves heard to intimate Beijing to stop spreading fake news and more on our skin.

無一段話過係個外長講
似係串個外長嘅社論多啲

quote.msg:
Google translate

Hua Chunying is the spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Minister, as well as general director of the Beijing Information Department, that is, she is among the leaders of Chinese propaganda. His role evidently also includes spreading fake news, like the one he tweeted from his official profile.

The Beijing spokeswoman showed pictures of some Italians who came out on the balconies on Saturday at noon to applaud the medical and hospital staff engaged in dealing with the epidemiological emergency, also from China, explaining that the Italians had come to the windows to sing "Thank you China" and to spread the Chinese anthem on the streets of Rome in gratitude for the Chinese help in defeating the virus. By clicking on the video, the applause of the Italians is heard and the Chinese anthem is marked in the background. His deputy, Lijian Zhao, did the same thing.

We have other emergencies, other problems and maybe there will also have been someone who screamed thanks China, but if we were a serious country, the Farnesina and the minister who unfortunately the guide would make themselves heard to intimate Beijing to stop spreading fake news and more on our skin.

無一段話過係個外長講
似係串個外長嘅社論多啲
